intro: Corydalis taliensis var. taliensis, commonly known as the Taliensis Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a suitable candidate for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is complemented by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
